goals.question: What is the trend of CO2 concentration over time?
goals.visualization: Line chart of CO2 concentration over time
goals.rationale: This visualization helps to identify if there is an increasing or decreasing trend of CO2 concentration over time.

goals.question: What is the average CO2 concentration by year?
goals.visualization: Bar chart of average CO2 concentration by year
goals.rationale: This visualization helps to identify the year with the highest and lowest average CO2 concentration.

goals.question: What is the distribution of CO2 concentration?
goals.rationale: This visualization helps to identify the range of CO2 concentration and if there are any outliers.

goals.question: What is the correlation between CO2 concentration and temperature?
goals.visualization: Scatter plot of CO2 concentration and temperature
goals.rationale: This visualization helps to identify if there is a positive or negative correlation between CO2 concentration and temperature.

goals.question: What is the seasonal pattern of CO2 concentration?
goals.visualization: Line chart of CO2 concentration by month
goals.rationale: This visualization helps to identify if there is a seasonal pattern of CO2 concentration and if there are any trends over time.

code:
import seaborn as sns
import pandas as pd
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

def plot(data: pd.DataFrame):
    data['date'] = pd.to_datetime(data['date'], errors='coerce')
    data = data[pd.notna(data['date'])]

    plt.figure(figsize=(12, 6))
    sns.lineplot(x='date', y='co2_concentration', data=data)
    plt.title('What is the trend of CO2 concentration over time?', wrap=True)
    plt.xlabel('Date')
    plt.ylabel('CO2 Concentration')
    plt.xticks(rotation=45)
    plt.legend(['CO2 Concentration'])

    return plt;

chart = plot(data)

import seaborn as sns
import pandas as pd
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

def plot(data: pd.DataFrame):
    data['Year'] = pd.to_datetime(data['Year'], errors='coerce')
    data = data[pd.notna(data['Year'])]
    data['Year'] = data['Year'].dt.year
    yearly_avg = data.groupby('Year')['CO2 Concentration'].mean().reset_index()

    ax = sns.barplot(x='Year', y='CO2 Concentration', data=yearly_avg)
    plt.xticks(rotation=45)
    plt.title('What is the average CO2 concentration by year?', wrap=True)
    plt.legend(title='Year', loc='upper left', labels=yearly_avg['Year'].unique())
    return plt;

chart = plot(data)

import seaborn as sns
import pandas as pd
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

def plot(data: pd.DataFrame):
    sns.histplot(data=data, x='CO2 concentration', kde=True, color='blue')
    plt.axvline(data['CO2 concentration'].median(), color='red', linestyle='--', label=f"Median: {data['CO2 concentration'].median():.2f}")
    plt.title('What is the distribution of CO2 concentration?', wrap=True)
    plt.legend()
    return plt;

chart = plot(data)

import seaborn as sns
import pandas as pd
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

def plot(data: pd.DataFrame):
    sns.scatterplot(data=data, x='CO2_concentration', y='temperature')
    plt.title('What is the correlation between CO2 concentration and temperature?', wrap=True)
    plt.xlabel('CO2 Concentration')
    plt.ylabel('Temperature')
    return plt;

chart = plot(data)

import seaborn as sns
import pandas as pd
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import matplotlib.dates as mdates

def plot(data: pd.DataFrame):
    data['Date'] = pd.to_datetime(data['Date'], errors='coerce')
    data = data[pd.notna(data['Date'])]
    data['Month'] = data['Date'].dt.month

    plt.figure(figsize=(12, 6))
    sns.lineplot(x='Month', y='CO2_concentration', data=data, ci=None)
    plt.title('What is the seasonal pattern of CO2 concentration?', wrap=True)
    plt.xlabel('Month')
    plt.ylabel('CO2 Concentration')
    plt.xticks(range(1, 13), ['Jan', 'Feb', 'Mar', 'Apr', 'May', 'Jun', 'Jul', 'Aug', 'Sep', 'Oct', 'Nov', 'Dec'])

    return plt;

chart = plot(data)
